prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Pointed End Sketch Create a new coordinate system with the euler angles and translation vector provided in the `coordinate_system` property. Begin the sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. Create the first face, `face_1`, of the sketch: 1. Draw the first line, `line_1`, from the point (0, 0) to the point (0.3318, 0). 2. Draw the second line, `line_2`, from the point (0.3318, 0) to the point (0.3318, 0.5841). 3. Draw the arc, `arc_1`, from the point (0.3318, 0.5841) to the point (0, 0.5841) with the mid point at (0.1659, 0.4182). 4. Close the loop by drawing the fourth line, `line_3`, from the point (0, 0.5841) to the starting point (0, 0). Create the second face, `face_2`, of the sketch: 1. Draw the arc, `arc_1`, from the point (0, 0.5841) to the point (0.3318, 0.5841) with the same mid point as before. 2. Complete the face by drawing a line, `line_1`, from (0.3318, 0.5841) back to the starting point (0, 0.5841). Create the third face, `face_3`, of the sketch: 1. This face is identical to face_2, creating another arc from (0, 0.5841) to (0.3318, 0.5841). 2. Close the face by completing the loop with a line, `line_1`, from (0.3318, 0.5841) back to the starting point (0, 0.5841). Extrusion With the completed sketch, use the provided values in the `extrusion` property to extrude the sketch in a specific direction and add a scaling factor: 1. Extrude the sketch by a depth of 0.0149 towards the normal vector. 2. Do not extrude in the opposite direction of the normal vector. 3. Scale the sketch by using the 0.5841 factor. After extruding the sketch and completing the remaining `operation`, the resulting shape should match the `shape`, `length`, `width`, and `height` properties provided in the `description` property.</description>

Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0237, 0.0534, 0.0] Next, create the 2D sketch for this part on a plane defined by the coordinate system. The sketch contains two faces: - Face 1: This face consists of two loops: - Loop 1: This loop is made up of four arcs and one line. The arcs are defined as follows: - Arc 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.1903], Mid Point [0.0386, 0.1757], End Point [0.0675, 0.1461] - Arc 2: Start Point [0.0675, 0.1461], Mid Point [0.2623, 0.0], End Point [0.5044, 0.0252] - Arc 3: Start Point [0.5044, 0.0252], Mid Point [0.5317, 0.0295], End Point [0.5561, 0.0167] - Arc 4: Start Point [0.5561, 0.0167], Mid Point [0.4503, 0.6833], End Point [0.0, 0.1903] The loop is closed by the line: - Line 1: Start Point [0.5561, 0.0167], End Point [0.5866, 0.0297] - Loop 2: This loop is made up of one line and one arc. The line and arc are defined as follows: - Line 1: Start Point [0.3036, 0.5282], End Point [0.3989, 0.5282] - Arc 1: Start Point [0.3989, 0.5713], Mid Point [0.3513, 0.0674], End Point [0.3036, 0.5713] Then, scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.6833. Next, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying the following Euler angles and translation vector: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Finally, extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector to create the 3D model. The extrusion depth is 0.0159 units. **Instructions for part 2** Construct a 3D model of a circular object with a flat, curved top and a flat, curved bottom, connected by a straight line. The object is symmetrical and has a central hole. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0285, 0.0463, 0.0] Next, create the 2D sketch for this part on a plane defined by the coordinate system. The sketch contains one face: - Face 1: This face consists of one loop: - Loop 1: This loop is made up of four arcs. The arcs are defined as follows: - Arc 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.1852], Mid Point [0.0391, 0.172], End Point [0.069, 0.1434] - Arc 2: Start Point [0.069, 0.1434], Mid Point [0.2892, 0. ```</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and a flat bottom. The sides of the prism are parallel and meet at right angles. The prism is centered on a white background. 1. **Create a new coordinate system**: Establish the coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] 2. **Generate the 2D sketch**: Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 3. **Draw the curves**: Draw the following individual straight lines that will form the loop for the face: - Line 1: From point [0.0, 0.2671] to point [0.1243, 0.1129] - Line 2: From point [0.1243, 0.1129] to point [0.37, 0.0] - Line 3: From point [0.37, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.0614] - Line 4: From point [0.75, 0.0614] to point [0.6357, 0.3586] - Line 5: From point [0.6357, 0.3586] to point [0.0, 0.2671] 4. **Create loops**: Form a single loop by connecting the ending point of one line to the starting point of the other line. This results in the loop being clockwise. 5. **Create faces**: Since this loop is clockwise, it creates an explicit face. 6. **Scale the 2D sketch**: Apply a scale transformation to the entire sketch, using the scale factor: 0.75 7. **Transform 2D sketch into 3D sketch**: Using the current coordinate system's orientation, project the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector provided. 8. **Extrude the 2D sketch**: The extrusion depth toward the normal is 0.1669. The extrusion depth opposite the normal is 0.0, as there is no opposing extrusion. The sketch scale is also 0.75, matching the applied scaling factor. The final dimensions for part 1 are: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.75 - Height: 0.1669 With these instructions, the junior CAD designer will generate the specified three-dimensional rectangular prism with the required taper and dimensions.</description>

Close the loop. Extrusion Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis by 0.75 units. Set the sketch scale to 0.1484. Description The shape of this part is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional, Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Step 1: Create the coordinate system The first step is to create a new coordinate system for this part. The Euler angles should be set to 0 degrees in all three axes, and the translation vector should be set to [0, 0, 0]. Step 2: Draw a 2D sketch Create a new 2D sketch on the XY plane defined by the coordinate system. The sketch should have a single face. Step 3: Draw the curves for the first face The first face has eight line segments. Start by drawing a line segment from [0, 0.0274] to [0.0274, 0]. Then, draw a line segment from [0.0274, 0] to [0.7226, 0]. Continue drawing line segments from [0.7226, 0] to [0.75, 0.0274], [0.75, 0.0274] to [0.75, 0.6113], [0.75, 0.6113] to [0.7226, 0.6387], [0.7226, 0.6387] to [0.0274, 0.6387], [0.0274, 0.6387] to [0.0, 0.6113], and finally, draw a line segment from [0.0, 0.6113] to [0.0, 0.0274]. Step 4: Create loops and faces Close the first loop with all the line segments from step 3. This loop defines the first face of the prism. The face should be a rectangle with one rounded corner. Step 5: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Step 6: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the coordinate system's euler angles and translation vector. Step 7: Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with an extrusion depth of 0.0091 towards the normal and 0.0 opposite the normal. The resulting part is a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The prism is 0.75 units in length and width, and 0.0091 units in height.</description>
